newsitem.title: USA: Alaska, oil co's to pursue N. Slope natgas sales.
newsitem.headline: Alaska, oil co's to pursue N. Slope natgas sales.

text.p: Alaska Governor Tony Knowles on Thursday signed two memorandums of understanding that set the framework for developing natural gas sales from Alaska's huge North Slope reserves.
North Slope gas reserves are estimated at 35 trillion cubic feet, the largest of any U.S. state, according to a statement from the governor's office.
"These documents...show potential customers and interested project sponsors that the State and industry are serious about developing this tremendous resource," Knowles said in the statement.
Knowles signed one memorandum with the Slope's three major gas field owners, ARCO Alaska Inc., British Petroleum Co's BP Exploration Inc, and Exxon Corp.
A second memorandum is with Yukon Pacific Corp, a pipeline company majority-owned by CSX Corp.

The memorandum calls for cutting development costs, now estimated at $15 billion. It notes Alaska must change its fiscal system to improve the gas project's competitiveness, and that the project should protect the environment.
The memorandum also sets a goal of hiring Alaskans and hiring Alaskan companies, the statement said.
Until now, the state's natural gas has largely been reinjected back into North Slope oil fields to enhance production.
"There's no more opportune time to take the necessary steps to make the gas available to the rapidly developing economies of Asia," Knowles said.
